newsitem.title: PHILIPPINES: PRESS DIGEST - Philippine newspapers - April 4.
newsitem.headline: PRESS DIGEST - Philippine newspapers - April 4.

text.p: These are the leading stories in Manila newspapers on Friday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
- Three persons were kidnapped in two separate incidents in Mindanao yesterday, bringing to 34 the number of victims abducted by suspected Moslem rebels since January last year. (STAR)

- Former First Lady Imelda Marcos said yesterday former Armed Forces chief of staff General Fabian Ver, who was ousted with her family in 1986, may be able to identify the person who ordered the death of opposition leader Benigno Aquino. (STANDARD)

- Senators yesterday completed their probe of the controversial land reclamation deal between the Public Estates Authority and the Amari Corp. They will recommend the renegotiation of the transaction to seek a better deal for the government and the immediate prosecution of those involved. (ALL NEWSPAPERS)

- Food and beverage giant San Miguel Corp yesterday announced it would combine its 70 percent-owned unit Coca-Cola Bottlers Philippines Inc with Australia's Coca-Cola Amatil Ltd in a $2.7 billion-merger. (ALL NEWSPAPERS)
- Prices of gasoline, including diesel, are expected to go up next week, but prices of socially-sensitive products like kerosene, fuel oil and cooking gas, will be reduced. (ALL NEWSPAPERS)
